intro: Aulomyrcia karuaiensis, commonly known as the Karuai endemic, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Aulomyrcia karuaiensis is primarily found in shaded, humid environments and is adapted to thrive in the understory of dense forest canopies.
